en-US.Pass: 'aria-activedescendant' is used appropriately for this combobox
en-US.Fail_missing: The element referenced by 'aria-activedescendant' "{0}" does not exist
en-US.Fail_not_in_popup: The element referenced by 'aria-activedescendant' "{0}" does not exist within the popup referenced by 'id' "{1}"
en-US.Fail_active_role_invalid: The 'aria-activedescendant' "{0}" references an element with the roles "{1}", which does not have a valid ARIA role of 'option', 'gridcell', 'row', or 'treeitem'
en-US.Fail_active_not_selected: The 'aria-activedescendant' "{0}" references an element that does not have 'aria-selected' set to true
en-US.group: 'aria-activedescendant' must be used to define focus within the combobox popup, except when using a dialog popup

en-US.Pass: The combobox does not use 'aria-autocomplete' value '"inline"' nor does it have 'aria-autocomplete' defined within the popup
en-US.Fail_1: The combobox has the 'aria-autocomplete' attribute incorrectly set on an element within the popup referenced by "{0}"
en-US.Fail_inline: The combobox does not support an 'aria-autocomplete' attribute value set to '"inline"'
en-US.group: A combobox that supports autocompletion behavior must have the 'aria-autocomplete' attribute only on its text input element with a valid value; a value of '"inline"' is not supported

en-US.Pass: DOM focus is allowed only on the combobox element as required
en-US.Fail_not_tabbable: The combobox element does not allow DOM focus as required
en-US.Fail_tabbable_child: The popup of the combobox has DOM focus or has 'aria-activedescendant' defined, which is not allowed
en-US.group: Tabbable focus for the combobox must be allowed only on the text input, except when using a dialog popup

en-US.Pass: The 'aria-controls' (ARIA 1.2) or 'aria-owns' (ARIA 1.0) appropriately references a valid popup 'id' value
en-US.Fail_popup_role_invalid: The 'role' value "{0}" of the popup element "{1}" should be one of "listbox", "grid", "tree" or "dialog"
en-US.Fail_combobox_popup_role_mismatch: The value of the combobox 'aria-haspopup' attribute "{0}" does not match the 'role' value of the popup element "{1}"
en-US.group: The combobox attribute 'aria-haspopup' value must be appropriate for the role of the element referenced by 'aria-controls' (ARIA 1.2) or 'aria-owns' (ARIA 1.0)
The 'aria-controls' (for ARIA 1.2) or the 'aria-owns' (for ARIA 1.0) attribute of the expanded combobox must reference a valid popup 'id' value
en-US.Pass_expanded: The combobox popup referenced by 'aria-controls' (ARIA 1.2) or 'aria-owns' (ARIA 1.0) exists and is visible
en-US.Pass_collapsed: The combobox popup in its collapsed state does not reference any visible popup as required
en-US.Fail_1.0_missing_owns: The 'aria-owns' attribute of the expanded combobox is missing
en-US.Fail_1.2_missing_controls: The 'aria-controls' attribute of the expanded combobox is missing
en-US.Fail_1.0_popup_reference_missing: The 'aria-owns' attribute "{0}" of the expanded combobox does not reference a valid popup 'id' value
en-US.Fail_1.2_popup_reference_missing: The 'aria-controls' attribute "{0}" of the expanded combobox does not reference a valid popup 'id' value
en-US.Fail_combobox_expanded_hidden: The combobox 'aria-expanded' attribute is true, but the combobox popup is not visible
en-US.Fail_combobox_collapsed_visible: The combobox 'aria-expanded' attribute is false, but the combobox popup is visible

en-US.Pass_1.0: The combobox design pattern is detected as ARIA 1.0, which is allowed by ARIA 1.2
en-US.Fail_1.1: The combobox design pattern is detected as ARIA 1.1, which is not allowed by ARIA 1.2
en-US.Pass_1.2: The combobox design pattern is detected as ARIA 1.2
en-US.group: The combobox design pattern must be valid for ARIA 1.2

Audio information should also be available in text form

en-US.Potential_1: Filename used as label for embedded audio or video
en-US.group: Audio or video on the page must have a short text alternative that describes the media content

en-US.Manual_1: Verify captions are provided for live media (streaming video with audio)
en-US.group: Live media (streaming video with audio) should have captions for audio content

en-US.Manual_1: Verify availability of a user-selectable audio track with description of visual content
en-US.group: Pre-recorded media should have an audio track that describes visual information

en-US.Potential_1: Verify page is not being caused to refresh automatically
Verify that ASCII art has a text alternative
en-US.group: ASCII art must have a text alternative

en-US.Potential_1: Possible use of a script to emulate a link
en-US.group: Scripts should not be used to emulate links

en-US.Potential_1: Verify that 'onclick' events are not used in script to emulate a link
en-US.group: Scripts should not be used to emulate links

en-US.Potential_1: Verify the CSS background image does not convey important information
en-US.group: Images included by using CSS alone must not convey important information
Combine color and descriptive markup to convey information
en-US.Potential_1: Verify color is not used as the only visual means of conveying information

en-US.group: The keyboard focus indicator must be highly visible when default border or outline is modified by CSS
en-US.Potential_1: Check the keyboard focus indicator is highly visible when using CSS declaration for 'border' or 'outline'

en-US.Manual_1: Confirm Windows high contrast mode is supported when using CSS to include, position or alter non-decorative content
en-US.group: Windows high contrast mode must be supported when using CSS to include, position or alter non-decorative content

en-US.Potential_1: Verify table is not being used to format text content in columns unless the table can be linearized
en-US.group: Avoid using tables to format text documents in columns unless the table can be linearized

en-US.Potential_1: If the word(s) '{0}' is part of instructions for using page content, check it is still understandable without this location or shape information
en-US.group: Instructions must be meaningful without shape or location words

en-US.Potential_2: Verify that using the filename as the page <title> value is descriptive
en-US.group: Page <title> should be a descriptive title, rather than a filename

en-US.Pass_0: the hover: pseudo-class is not used to display content
en-US.Pass_1: content displayed via the :hover pseudo-class is a direct child of the trigger element
en-US.Pass_2: content displayed via the :hover pseudo-class is the adjacent sibling of the trigger element
en-US.Potential_1: Confirm the pointer can be positioned over the displayed element, not just the trigger
en-US.Potential_2: Confirm the pointer can be positioned over all the information displayed on hover
en-US.Potential_3: Confirm the margin style attribute has not prevented the pointer from hovering over the displayed element, not just the trigger
en-US.group: The pointer should be able to move over content displayed on hover

context: aria:table dom:tr[role], aria:table dom:th[role], aria:table dom:td[role], aria:grid dom:tr[role], aria:grid dom:th[role], aria:grid dom:td[role], aria:treegrid dom:tr[role], aria:treegrid dom:th[role], aria:treegrid dom:td[role]

en-US.group: Table structure elements cannot specify an explicit 'role' within table containers
en-US.explicit_role: An explicit ARIA 'role' is not valid for <{0}> element within a ARIA role '{1}' per the ARIA in HTML specification

en-US.Fail_1: The 'headers' attribute value "{0}" does not reference a valid 'id' in this document
en-US.Fail_2: The 'headers' attribute value "{0}" refers to itself
en-US.Fail_3: The 'headers' attribute value "{0}" does not refer to a cell in the same table
en-US.Fail_4: The 'headers' attribute value "{0}" does not refer to a cell indicated with <th> or a role of "columnheader" or "rowheader"
en-US.group: The 'headers' attribute should refer to a valid cell in the same table

en-US.Potential_1: If the following text is a quotation, mark it as a <q> or <blockquote> element: {0}
en-US.group: Quotations should be marked with <q> or <blockquote> elements

en-US.Fail_1: The <table> element has an empty <caption> element
en-US.group: A <caption> element for a <table> element must contain descriptive text

en-US.Fail_1: <caption> element is not nested inside a <table> element
en-US.group: The <caption> element must be nested inside the associated <table> element

en-US.Fail_1: Invalid value used for the 'dir' attribute

en-US.group: A <frame> containing non-HTML content must be made accessible

en-US.Pass_Regular: <label> element has accessible name with inner content
en-US.Fail_1: The <label> element does not have descriptive text that identifies the expected input
en-US.group: A <label> element must have non-empty descriptive text that identifies the purpose of the interactive component

en-US.Potential_1: Add descriptive text to the <noembed> element

en-US.Fail_1: Complex table does not have headers for each cell properly defined with 'header' or 'scope'
en-US.group: For a complex data table, all <th> and <td> elements must be related via 'header' or 'scope' attributes
Hyperlinks must have a text description of their purpose
en-US.Pass_0: Hyperlink has a description of its purpose
en-US.Fail_1: Hyperlink has no link text, label or image with a text alternative

en-US.group: Users should be warned in advance if their input action will open a new window or otherwise change their context
en-US.Potential_1: Inform the user when their input action will open a new window or otherwise change their context

en-US.group: <applet> elements must provide an 'alt' attribute and an alternative description
en-US.Fail_1: An <applet> element does not have an 'alt' attribute that provides a short text alternative
en-US.Fail_2: The 'alt' attribute value for an <applet> element duplicates the 'code' attribute
en-US.Fail_3: An <applet> element provides alternative text, but does not provide inner content

en-US.group: <area> elements in an image map must have a text alternative
en-US.Fail_1: <area> element in an image map has no text alternative

en-US.group: Content that blinks persistently must not be used

en-US.Potential_1: Verify that if this hyperlink skips content, the description communicates where it links to
en-US.group: The description of a hyperlink used to skip content must communicate where it links to

en-US.Fail_1: The page does not provide a way to quickly navigate to the main content (ARIA "main" landmark or a skip link)
en-US.group: Pages must provide a way to skip directly to the main content
The page should have a title that correctly identifies the subject of the page
en-US.Fail_1: Missing <head> element so there can be no <title> element present
'accesskey' attribute value on the element is not unique
en-US.group: 'accesskey' attribute values on each element must be unique for the page

en-US.Potential_1: Verify that the <embed> element is immediately followed by a non-embedded element
en-US.group: <embed> elements should be immediately followed by a non-embedded element
<fieldset> elements must have a single, non-empty <legend> as a label

en-US.Potential_1: Verify the <form> element has a submit button or an image button
en-US.group: A <form> element should have a submit button or an image button

en-US.Potential_1: Verify that interacting with content will not open pop-up windows or change the active window without informing the user
en-US.group: User should be informed in advance when interacting with content causes a change of context
Inline frames must have a unique, non-empty 'title' attribute
en-US.Fail_1: Inline frame does not have a 'title' attribute

en-US.group: Page must identify the default language of the document with a 'lang' attribute
en-US.Fail_1: Page detected as XHTML 1.0, but has neither 'lang' nor 'xml:lang' attributes
en-US.Fail_2: Page detected as XHTML, but does not have an 'xml:lang' attribute
en-US.Fail_3: Page detected as HTML, but does not have a 'lang' attribute
en-US.Fail_4: Page detected with 'lang' and 'xml:lang' attributes and primary languages do not match: "{0}", "{1}"
en-US.Fail_5: Page detected with 'lang' and 'xml:lang' attributes that do not match: "{0}", "{1}"
en-US.Potential_5: Page detected as XHTML 1.0 with only a 'lang' attribute. Confirm that page is only delivered via text/html mime type
en-US.Potential_6: Page detected as XHTML 1.0 with only an 'xml:lang' attribute. Confirm that page is only delivered via xml mime type

en-US.Fail_1: Image 'alt' attribute value consists only of whitespace
en-US.Fail_2: Image does not have an 'alt' attribute short text alternative
en-US.Fail_3: Image does not have an 'alt' attribute and 'title' attribute value consists only of whitespace
en-US.group: Images must have an 'alt' attribute with a short text alternative if they convey meaning, or 'alt="" if decorative

en-US.Fail_1: Link text is repeated in an image 'alt' value within the same link
en-US.Fail_2: Link text of previous link is repeated in image 'alt' value of a link
en-US.Fail_3: Image 'alt' value within a link is repeated in link text of the link after
en-US.group: The text alternative for an image within a link should not repeat the link text or adjacent link text

en-US.Fail_1: Image designated as decorative has non-null 'alt' attribute
en-US.group: Image designated as decorative must have 'alt=""

en-US.Fail_1: The image 'alt' attribute is empty, but the 'title' attribute is not empty
en-US.group: When the image 'alt' attribute is empty, the 'title' attribute must also be empty

en-US.Fail_1: Form control element <{0}> has no associated label
en-US.Fail_2: Form control with "{0}" role has no associated label
en-US.group: Each form control must have an associated label

en-US.Pass_0: Image button provides alternative text using the 'alt' attribute
en-US.Pass_1: Image button provides alternative text using a ARIA label
en-US.Pass_2: Image button provides alternative text using the 'title' attribute
en-US.Fail: The <input> element of type "image" has no text alternative
en-US.group: The <input> element of type "image" should have a text alternative

en-US.Potential_1: Verify that any changes of context are explained in advance to the user
en-US.group: Verify that any changes of context are explained in advance to the user

en-US.Potential_1: Use the <fieldset> element to group logically related input elements
en-US.group: Groups of logically related input elements should be contained within a <fieldset> element

en-US.Fail_1: Checkbox or radio button is nested in label, so label is not after the input control
en-US.Fail_2: Label text is located before its associated checkbox or radio button element
en-US.group: Checkboxes and radio buttons must have a label after the input control

en-US.Fail_1: Text input is nested in label such that input precedes the label text
en-US.Fail_2: Label text is located after its associated text input or <select> element
en-US.group: Text inputs and <select> elements must have a label before the input control
Related sets of radio buttons or checkboxes should be programmatically grouped
en-US.Pass_LoneNogroup: {0} grouping not required for a control of this type
en-US.Pass_Grouped: {0} input is grouped with other related controls with the same name
en-US.Pass_RadioNoName: Radio input is not grouped, but passes because it has no name to group with other radio inputs
en-US.Fail_ControlNameMismatch: {0} input found that has the same name, "{2}" as a {1} input
en-US.Fail_NotGroupedOtherGrouped: {0} input is not in the group with another {0} with the name "{1}"
en-US.Fail_NotGroupedOtherNotGrouped: {0} input and others with the name "{1}" are not grouped together
en-US.Fail_NotSameGroup: {0} input is in a different group than another {0} with the name "{1}"
en-US.Potential_LoneCheckbox: Verify that this ungrouped checkbox input is not related to other checkboxes
en-US.Potential_UnnamedCheckbox: Verify that this un-named, ungrouped checkbox input is not related to other checkboxes

en-US.Potential_1: The input element does not have an associated visible label
en-US.group: An input element must have an associated visible label

en-US.Fail_1: The value "{0}" of the 'for' attribute is not the 'id' of a valid <input> element
en-US.group: The 'for' attribute must reference a non-empty, unique 'id' attribute of an <input> element
Page should not automatically refresh without warning or option to turn it off or adjust the time limit
en-US.fail: Check page does not automatically refresh without warning or options
en-US.fail_longrefresh: Check page does not automatically refresh without warning or options

en-US.group: <object> elements must have a text alternative for the content rendered by the object
en-US.Fail_1: An <object> element does not have a text alternative

en-US.Potential_1: Verify script does not remove focus from content that normally receives focus
en-US.group: Scripting must not remove focus from content that normally receives focus

en-US.Potential_1: Group of related options may need <optgroup>
en-US.group: Groups of related options within a selection list should be grouped with <optgroup>

en-US.Potential_1: Verify that no change of context or action occurs when selection options in this component receive focus
en-US.group: No changes of context should occur when a selection value receives focus
Do not use CSS '::before' and '::after' pseudo-elements to insert non-decorative content
en-US.Potential_1: Verify the '::before' and '::after' pseudo-elements do not insert non-decorative content

en-US.Fail_1: The table summary duplicates the caption
en-US.group: The table summary must not duplicate the caption

en-US.Fail_1: Value provided is invalid for the 'scope' attribute
en-US.Fail_2: The 'scope' attribute should only be used on a <th> element
en-US.group: Value for 'scope' attribute must be "row", "col", "rowgroup", or "colgroup"

en-US.Fail_1: The <{0}> element with "presentation" role or "none" role has structural element(s) and/or attribute(s) '{1}'
en-US.group: Table elements with 'role="presentation" or 'role="none" should not have structural elements or attributes

en-US.Potential_1: Verify that emoticons have a text alternative
en-US.group: Emoticons must have a short text alternative that describes their purpose

en-US.Potential_1: Verify space characters are not being used to create space between the letters of a word
en-US.group: Use CSS 'letter-spacing' to control spacing within a word
The 'autocomplete' attribute's token(s) must be appropriate for the input form field
en-US.Fail_1: The 'autocomplete' attribute's token(s) are not appropriate for the input form field
en-US.Fail_attribute_incorrect: The 'autocomplete' attribute has an incorrect value

en-US.Fail_1: Accessible name does not match or contain the visible label text
en-US.group: Accessible name must match or contain the visible label text
Text must scale up to 200% without loss of content or functionality
en-US.Potential_1: Verify that text sized using viewport units can be resized up to 200%
